result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. Sjostrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A. Sjostrom

defendant.name: Sjostrom, David A.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David A. Sjostrom in court with attorney Blake Duren.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendation.  Plea to Count 1.  Attorney Duren agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.    No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.  Cash bond from other case to be applied to this case.  
Count 1:
$243.00 fine/costs, $200.00 DNA surcharge and $100.00 Dom. Abuse surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
Submit to DNA sample.
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant David A. Sjostrom in court with attorney Blake Duren. Mike Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Duren states wants at least texting for children issues.   Atty. Albrecht states no objection to returning to the home, victim has moved out.  Object to contact w/victim.  Court modifies bond to no contact w/MH except DE may contact MH via text messages only for care & well being of children. Not to engage in any profane/disorderly with victim.  May retrieve to the home if victim not living there.

Defendant David A. Sjostrom in court.  Court reviews financial information.  Court appoints Attorney Blake Duren, 158 E Main Street, Reedsburg, WI  608-415-9066 @$65/hr @ $25.00 /week commencing January 8, 2016 and weekly thereafter.

Pre-trial conference at 01-15-2016 11:00 am.
Return date at 01-28-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant David A. Sjostrom appeared by video means with Attorney Raabe. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date. $500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with M.H., her residence or premises.  May return one time with law enf. to pick up personal property and upon notice.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
